intro: Carpolobia alba, commonly known as the white carpolobia, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, tropical environments and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. The species is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
